scoring_rules.content: Ensure that scores provided in the reasoning text match the scores in the 'scores' section.
Provide clear and logical reasoning for all scores, including the global score.
For plant-based meat alternatives, high protein content (>15g/100g) should increase the utility score by 10-15 points, reflecting its value to consumers seeking protein-rich plant-based options.
High salt content (>1.5g/100g) should decrease the utility score by 10-15 points, due to health concerns associated with high sodium intake.
Products classified as NOVA group 4 (ultra-processed) should have their utility score capped at 70, reflecting the negative perception of ultra-processed foods among health-conscious consumers.

If a product has a high salt content (>2.0g/100g) and is classified as a NOVA group 4 product, the utility score should be decreased by an additional 5-10 points, reflecting the compounded health concerns associated with high sodium intake and ultra-processed foods.

packaging_patterns.content: Non-recyclable packaging should decrease the attractiveness score by 5-10 points and the positioning score by 10-15 points for plant-based products, reflecting the importance of sustainability to consumers of these products.
